IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: Narrative: On 5/21/2023 at approximately 0041 hours, I was dispatched to 9600 Cordova Rd, Easton MD. In reference to a check welfare. Upon my arrival, I met with the complainant Dina Marie Spry and the suspect Somer Eileen Wilkes, who were both on the front porch, and I observed Wilkes to be heavily intoxicated. Spry stated the following. She received a phone call from her sister, Carol Ann Wise and was told that Wilkes was holding a blanket over Wilkes infants face. Wilkes was drunk and she is not supposed to be drinking, due to a current open Department of Social Services case. I asked Spry for her identification, as she walked to her vehicle. At that time, I made contact with Wilkes. I questioned Wilkes on what happened and she stated nothing. I then asked Wilkes if she needed EMS to come check on her due to her intoxication, which she refused. I questioned Wilkes if the infant was ok, as she nodded yes, waved me into the residence and walked me to the infants location. Wilkes walked me into a bedroom where I observed a sleeping toddler and an infant who was stirring around. The infant was not crying, screaming, wheezing or in distress and I did not observe any injuries or signs of injuries on the infant. As Wilkes walked me through her residence, we took a right turn from the front kitchen door into the living room, walked through the living room and made a left turn into the bedroom where the infant and toddler were located. I observed closed window curtains throughout the house and both the living room and bedroom did not appear disturbed. At that time, I walked Wilkes back outside onto the porch. While on the porch DSS worker Leah Borkowski, contacted Spry. Spry explained to Borkowski that Wilkes was intoxicated and put a blanket of the infants head. Spry then handed me the phone and I spoke with Borkowski. Borkowski stated there is a safety plan in place, but nothing about Wilkes alcohol use. Borkowski stated she needed to contact her supervisor and would be in touch after doing so. I walked back to the porch, gave Spry her phone back, and observed a vehicle pull on scene. I made contact with Carol Ann Wise, an occupant in the vehicle and she stated the following. Earlier in the evening, she was at Wilkes residence before Wilkes kicked her out and she left without incident, before returning later in the evening. When she returned to the residence, she observed a blanket over Wilkes infant, Wilkess arm over the baby and stating shut up. At that time, she picked the infant up and started patting the infants back. I asked Wise or Spry if they would be willing to take the toddler and infant for the night and Wise stated she would. I asked Spry to contact Borkowski and make sure that was ok. Wise repeated what had happened and she stated she could hear the infant from outside. After the incident, Wise left and contacted Spry and notified her. Spry stated she made contact with Borkowski but was waiting for a call back. While we were waiting I had Spry check on the children. Borkowski called Spry back and stated the following. After speaking with her supervisor, she asked if either Spry or Wise could stay at Wilkes residence or take the children for the remainder of the weekend, until Monday. Wise stated she was not staying at the house with Wilkes but would take the children home until Monday. Borkowski stated a verbal safety plan would be completed which would allow Wise to take the children until Monday. I then spoke to Borkowski and she confirmed that Wise would be taking the kids until Monday and the on-call worker social worker would contact Wilkes and Wise in the morning to complete the verbal safety plan. I explained to Borkowski that I would assist Wise and Spry gather the children and essential items. I assisted Wise and Spry with loading up the essential items in Wises vehicle as Wise was holding the infant. The infant began to wheeze and cough, when Wise stated the baby was sick with Rhinovirus. At that time, I requested EMS to respond to my location to check on the infant. Talbot County EMS responded to the residence and transported the infant to University of Maryland Shore Medical Center at Easton (run # 2023-00035983), per Wises request. Wise rode with the infant in the ambulance on the way to the hospital. Case OPEN pending further investigation. All events occurred in Talbot County MD

On June 7, 2023, at 1357 hours I, Sgt Antal, conducted an Interview with Carol Wise (Wise) at the Talbot County Department of Social Services. The following is a synopsis and not a comprehensive transcription of the interview with Wise which was audibly recorded: Wise stated that she was babysitting Somer Wilkes (Wilkes) two children, David Velazquez (DOB 8-3-2023) and Scarlett Velazquez (DOB 8-3-18) Wise stayed with Wilkes because of her (Wilkes) drinking problem and to help Wilkeswith her children Wilkes asked Wise to leave on the day of May20, 2023 Wise calledWilkes later that evening to check on her and recognized that Wilkes was intoxicated While on the phone Wilkes tells Wise that she has to get off the phone to deal with this fucking baby When Wise arrives to Wilkesresidence she can hear David Velazquez crying Wise was able to locate Wilkes keys on the front porch and make entry into the residence When Wise walks into the residence she can hear David Velazquez having trouble breathing Wise walkedinto bedroom and observedWilkes holding David Velazquez face-first to her chest, in fleece pajamas, a blanketover David Velazquezs head and her arm pressing David Velazquezs head against Wilkes chest Wise stated that Wilkes was yelling at David Velazquez to shut the fuck up Wise tookDavid Velazquez from Wilkes and observes that David Velazquez is beet red and sweating Wise opened David Velazquezs clothing to help him breath Wise stated that Scarlett Velazquezwas asleep during the incident When Wise asked Wilkes what was she trying to do Wilkes would not answer Wise asked Wilkes if she could take the children because of her level of intoxication Wise statedthat she does not believe that Wilkes was intentionally trying to kill David Velazquez Wilkes asked Wise to leave the residence,Wise left the residence then Wise contacted her sister Wise stated that after the police arrived, and she was able to take the children she observed David Velazquez to still having trouble breathing and decided to take David Velazquez to the Emergency Room Wise stated that Emergency Room staff stated Wilkes neglected to give David Velazquez a prescribed breathing treatment for a current illness which was compounded with theextra heat from clothing and Wilkes pressing his head to her chest Wise describedthat Wilkes was on her side laying on the bed and David Velazquez was laying on the bed with his nose facing Wilkeschest, one arm was under David Velazquezs rear and the other arm was over his head Wise could hear Wilkes yelling to David Velazquez in English and Spanish to shut up Wise was unable to tell how tight Wilkes was holding David Velazquez to her chest Wise stated that she does not believe that Wilkes was intentional trying to hurt David Velazquez but that when Wilkes drinks she does not know her strength Wise describedthe positions of Wilkes and David Velazquez Wise describedthe noiseDavid Velazquez was making and states that it sounded likeDavid Velazquezs breathing was being blocked Wise talkedabout a couple of incidents that she has heard of involving the children Wise stated that on the night of the incident Wilkes had three bottles of wine and that Wilkes drinks everyday When Wise was asked what she thought would have happened that night if she was not there she stated thatDavid Velazquez could have died Wise stated that the temperature in the residence was hot andDavid Velazquez was overheating Wise has known Wilkes for 30 years, and she had been drinking since her teens Wise stated that Scarlett Velazquez was on the bed towards the bottom Wise described some concerning eating behavior that the children have Wise describes Wilkes drinking issues Wise stated that she does not think Wilkes was intentionally trying to killDavid Velazquez but just didnt realize how hot he was Wise describes some mental health issues that Wilkes has

On June 12, 2023, I, Sgt Antal, completed an application for statement of charges for Somer E Wilkes. The Court Commissioner for Maryland District Court issued an arrest warrant for the following charges: Assault-First Degree Reckless Endangerment Assault-Second Degree Child Abuse: 2nd Degree Custody Neglect of Minor Intoxicated Endangerment On June 12, 2023, Troopers from the Maryland State Police Easton Barrack served Somer E. Wilkes with the arrest warrant at her residence. Case closed by arrest

On June 12, 2023, at 1532 hours, I, Sgt Antal, conducted an interview with Somer Wilkes at the Maryland State Police Easton Barrack. The following is a synopsis, not an exact transcript, of the interview that was audibly and visually recorded: -Wilkes was read and wavied her Miranda rights -Wilkes was asked if she remembers police showing up to her residence, which she states yes -Wilkes stated that she had three glasses of wine, she out her kids to sleep and watched a movie. -Wilkes further stated that a friend broke into her house and said that there was a blanket over Wilkes babys face -Wilkes stated that the blanket was not over the infants face -I asked why she would say that there was a blanket over the infants face, Wilkes did not have answer -Wilkes stated that her friend came into her room and Wilkes told her to shut the fuck up because the kids were sleeping -Wilkes stated that her friend called her sister and made a big deal out of nothing -When asked how Wise got into her house, Wilkes stated that she told her where the key was because Wise was watching the kids -When questioned about her level of intoxication level she stated that she was not drunk just tired from working -Wilkes was asked if she remembers falling with her daughter, Wilkes gives no answer -Wilkes stated that she wasnt drunk when she went to sleep -Wilkes stated that she has been to rehab since then and is taking classes for alcoholism -Wilkes questioned what the hospital stated that night that the infant was taken to the emergency department -Wilkes stated the infant was not getting his medicine was because the pharmacy did not have the medicine but that the infant did get the medication -I asked Wilkes what she was doing when Wise came into her bedroom, Wilkes stated that she was asleep in bed with her daughter and son -Wilkes stated again after the movie she went to sleep -Wilkes admitted that she had a drinking problem in the past -Wilkes stated that she was still fighting her addiction during the date of the incident -Wilkes stated that she did not learn coping skills and that is why she turned to alcohol -When asked if she could have unintentionally put the infant in harm, Wilkes stated no -Wilkes stated that she was not holding the infant in bed -I asked Wilkes if she remembers 100% of that night, Wilkes stated no. -I asked if Wilkes remembers the period of time when she woke up to the time the police got there, Wilkes stated no -Wilkes started to describe swaddling the infant and how he sleeps -Wilkes stated that the infant, because of the way he sleeps, caused the blanket to go over his face -Wilkes stated that she did not put the blanket over the infants face and that the infant did it -Wilkes stated that she could have picked the infant up when Wise got there, but she was not holding him when Wise walked into the room -When Wilkes was asked why Wise would make up this story, she stated to use her washer, Wilkes vehicle, and to stay out Wilkes house -When asked if she had created a good environment for her children Wilkes stated that for a month, I wasnt great -Wilkes was asked what happened during the incident when the police arrived and found the infant by himself on the floor -Wilkes stated that her roommate was in the house watching the infant -Wilkes talked about struggling with personal issues -Wilkes stated that she was not holding the infant when Wise walked in. -Wilkes continued to say that she did do anything Interview was then terminated

Criminal Enforcement Division - Eastern Region Supplemental Report Attachments Search Warrant: Talbot County Detention Center MSP Form 78: Cell Phones Talbot County Detention Center Documents Evidence Dark Blue Motorola Smartphone - Cracked Display Black Apple iPhone in Black Case Narrative Since the arrest of Wilkes, Velasquez had been in the care of a foster home located at 29243 Pin Oak Way, Easton, Talbot County, Maryland 21601. During the morning hours of June 29, 2023, the Easton Police Department responded to this location for the report of an unconscious and unresponsive infant who was later identified as Velasquez. Talbot County Emergency Medical Services provided resuscitatives measures and transported Valesquez to the University of Maryland Shore Medical Center at Easton where Velasquez was pronounced dead. In response to the death investigation of Velasquez, members of CEDER contacted the Talbot County Detention Center who advised that Wilkes cellular device and other belongings were currently being stored at their facility within their property room, and they a search and seizure warrant was required to seize the devices from that location. I, Corporal D. Tilghman #6254, authored a search and seizure warrant for the Property Room at the Talbot County Detention Center to seize the mobile devices belonging to Wilkes. The search and seizure warrant was reviewed and authorized by the Honorable Karen R. Ketterman, Judge of the District Court for Talbot County, Maryland on June 29, 2023 at 2101 hours. Troopers assigned to the Maryland State Police - Easton Barrack attempted to serve the search and seizure warrant; however, they were advised by staff at the Talbot County Detention Center that the cellular telephones belonging to Wilkes were released that same date at approximately 1530 hours to an individual identified as Suda Nicole Welch (Welch; W/F, DOB: 08/03/2022) who resides at 6181 Bethlehem Road, Preston, Caroline County, Maryland 21655. Troopers and I responded to that location and made contact with Welch who advised that she was in possession of two cellular devices that she retrieved from the detention center that belonged to Wilkes. I read the contents of an MSP Form 78: Consent to Search and Seize form and Welch provided written consent to seize the following two cellular devices: Dark Blue Motorola Smartphone - Cracked Display Black Apple iPhone in Black Case The above cellular devices were transported to and stored in the Maryland State Police - Easton Barrack property room pending the issuance of a search and seizure warrant to conduct data extractions on the devices. Case disposition to be determined by the lead investigator.

On June 21, 2023, at 1400 hours a forensic interview was conducted by the Talbot County Child Advocacy Center. The following narrative was authored by CPS Investigator, Leah Borkowski: Reason for Visit: Forensic interview of alleged victim and witness. Description of Visit: Erika Fenske conducted the forensic interview. CPS Investigator, Kristyn Wheeler, was present in the observation room with Chelsea Enzel with SAO, and Detective Antal with MSP. Scarlett was joined at the CAC by her foster care provider, Jess Flaherty, and her brother, David Velazquez. Please note that the following is a summary of the interview and is not a complete transcript. A DVD copy of the interview is available through the CAC. Erika Fenske utilized the FIT Protocol to structure the interview, to include rapport building, rules of the interview (I dont know, I dont understand, mistakes, and truth induction), and narrative practice. When prompted to tell what she was at the CAC to talk about today, Scarlett stated she did not know. When prompted to tell what she liked about her mom, Scarlett stated that she didnt know. When asked what she doesnt like about her mom, Scarlett said that she doesnt like her moms pencils. When asked what Scarlett does not like about Poppy, Scarlett said that she does like his truck, but that she doesnt like his pencils either. When asked why she doesnt like the pencils, she said that they arent in every color. When prompted to tell about what Scarlett does not like about baby David, Scarlett said that she doesnt like his crib because its small. When asked what makes Scarlett happy, Scarlett said that she likes her minnie mouse dress. When asked what makes her sad, Scarlett said the lights in the room. When asked about the rules at Scarletts home, Scarlett said something indiscernible. When asked about what happens when she breaks the rules, Scarlett said that she doesnt break the rules, and said that she colored on paper. Scarlett said that her mom told her something about eating noodles. When asked to tell about things that she has seen at home that she doesnt like, Scarlett talked about the ball that she was playing with. Erika and Scarlett took a break at this point. When asked about the food that Scarlett had at home with Mommy and Poppy, Scarlett said that she had seaweed. When asked about what Baby David ate at home, Scarlett said that he ate only milk. When asked how Scarlett knew when Baby David was hungry, Scarlett said that he likes his milk filled. Scarlett said that if his bottle isnt filled up, he will cry. When asked who fed Baby David, Scarlett said Papa did. When asked about Baby David crying, Scarlett said that he drinks milk. When asked what happened when Baby David cries, Scarlett said that she didnt know. When asked if there was ever a time that she did not have food with Mommy and Poppy, Scarlett said no. When asked if there was ever a time that Mommy did something that made her feel worried or scared, Scarlett said no. When asked if there was ever a time when Poppy did something that made her feel worried or scared, Scarlett said no. When asked if Scarlett ever felt worried or scared about Baby David, Scarlett said no. When asked who took care of her at home with Mommy and Poppy, Scarlett said Mommy and Papa. When asked how she was taken care of, Scarlett said she didnt know. When asked who took care of Baby David, Scarlett said Mommy and Papa. When asked what they did, Scarlett said they fed him milk. When asked what else they did to take care of him, Scarlett said they gave him his binky. When asked if there was a time when baby David wasnt taken care of, Scarlett said no. When asked about the things Scarlett told Jess about what Mommy did to Baby David, Scarlett said that she put a pillow over his head. When asked to tell everything about when he put a pillow over his head, Scarlett said that was so mean. When asked where they were when that happened, Scarlett said that they put him in the doctors office so that he could get back to normal. When asked if she saw mommy put a pillow over baby Davids head, Scarlett said she didnt. When asked how she knew about it, Scarlett said someone told her about it. When asked who told her about it, Scarlett said just someone. When asked how she felt about it, Scarlett didnt respond. When asked about it being mean, Scarlett spoke about the doctors office. When asked if Scarlett ever saw anything mean happened to baby David, Scarlett said no. When asked what Mommy did when baby David was in trouble, Scarlett said that he was eating milk. When asked what Mommy would do, Scarlett said that she put the pillow over his head. When asked what Baby David would do when the pillow was on his head, Scarlett said that he would die. When asked about the other things that Scarlett told Jess, Scarlett didnt say anything. When asked about Mommy hitting Scarlett, Scarlett said that Mommy hit her with the cup. When asked about which part of the body she was hit on, Scarlett said her tummy. When asked how it felt, Scarlett said that it was hurting. When asked if she was hit one time or more than one time, Scarlett said more than one time. When asked if she was hit on any other part of her body, Scarlett said only her stomach. When asked if Mommy hit Baby David too, Scarlett said that Mommy hit him in his face. When asked what he did when he was hit in the face, Scarlett said that he cried and cried and wanted his milk. When asked what Mommy used to hit baby David in the face, Scarlett said with the glass. When asked about the glass, Scarlett said with the window. When asked if Mommy hit David one time or more than one time, Scarlett said more than one time. When asked where Baby David slept at Mommys house, Scarlett said that he slept in his crib. When asked if Poppy ever hit Scarlett or baby David, Scarlett said no. When asked about Scarlett not liking it when doors are closed, Scarlett said she didnt know. When asked about what Scarlett said earlier about being afraid of being alone, Scarlett said that she wanted her cup at Jess house. When asked how she feels about staying at Jess house, Scarlett said that she is so happy. When asked to tell about the drinks at Mommy and Papas house, Scarlett said that she drank milk. When asked about what Mommy would drink, Scarlett said that Mommy drank juice. When asked about the juice, Scarlett said she drank orange juice. When asked if Mommy would drink anything else besides orange juice, Scarlett said no. When asked about what papa drank, Scarlett said that he drank soda. When asked if he ever put anything in the soda, Scarlett said no. When asked who cooked dinner, Scarlett said that Papa would make chicken. When asked if Scarlett liked living with Mommy and Papa, Scarlett said yes. When asked if anything made her feel scared or worried about living there, Scarlett didnt respond. Erika and Scarlett took a break at this point and concluded the interview.

On June 21, 2023, at 1524 hours an interview with Jess Flaherty at the Talbot County Child Advocacy Center. The following narrative was authored by CPS Leah Borkowski: CPS Investigator Kristyn Wheeler and MSP Detective Antel met with resource home/respite provider Jess Flaherty at the Talbot County Child Advocacy Center. Det. Antel told Jess that they had a few questions about how the comments by Scarlett came up. Jess explained that the first time that everything came up, Scarlett was at Jess home for day respite while another child was at the home as well. Jess explained that the other child shut the bedroom door while Scarlett was playing in the room with Jess daughter, and Scarlett became hysterical and began panicking in the corner of the room. Jess described that she entered the room and asked Scarlett what was wrong. Scarlett expressed fear and sadness about being in the room while it was locked, despite it not being locked. Jess described another time when she took Scarlett into the bathroom to wash her hands, and Scarlett began crying and hyperventilating about the door being shut. Jess explained that anytime the door is shut while she is in the room, she begins to panic. Jess shared that once overnights started, Scarlett would wake up every 20 minutes with night terrors where she screams and comes and gets Jess. Jess explained that Scarlett will say I need water, I need food and says Mommy locks me in the room and I cant eat, she doesnt let me eat and repeats herself saying the same thing. Jess told Kristyn and Det. Antel about a time when Scarlett told her that she was mean because Jess would not let Scarlett into her bedroom. Jess shared that she asked Scarlett about being let out of her room in the morning, and that Scarlett has told Jess that Scarletts mom hits her, hits her dad, hits Baby David, and that her dad is afraid of her mom. Jess shared that these disclosures will come up when Jess asks her whats wrong after Scarlett becomes very panicky. Jess explained that there was another time when David was in the family room in a bouncy seat while Jess was in another room, and Davids began screaming so she ran out to the family room. Jess described that Scarlett was in the family room attempting to lift David out of the seat when Jess worried she might accidentally hurt him so she lifted David from Scarletts hands. Jess explained that Scarlett became fearful by this and then told Jess that she hurt David on purpose. Jess told Scarlett that Scarlett did not hurt him on purpose and that it was an accident, but Scarlett repeated that she was bad and did try to hurt him. Jess expressed that she felt Scarlett was regurgitating something that she heard from someone else, Jess explained that she had spoken with this writer (CPS investigator Leah Borkowski) to seek guidance on what to do and this writer told Jess to start documenting the things that Scarlett disclosed to her. Jess explained that Scarlett disclosed that her mom hits her and David in the face. Jess also reported that Scarlett disclosed that mom puts the pillow over Davids face so he cant breathe. When asked if there was any indication if Scarlett saw those things happen herself, Jess explained that Scarlett said that she saw, as her and David sleep in the bed with their mom, and she saw her mom put the pillow on Davids face. When asked if Scarlett was able to disclose a number of times that this happened, Jess said that Scarlett could not, and that she also could not give context for when it might have happened. Jess shared that Scarlett disclosed that Mommy doesnt want me. Jess shared that when she spoke with Dina Spry about being in contact with Ms. Wilkes, Ms. Spry told her that everyone is afraid of Ms. Wilkes, including herself. Jess shared that Scarlett has disclosed that Ms. Wilkes will buy her things if she hits Scarlett, and that sometimes when Scarlett is upset, she will ask Jess will you buy me something if Im happy? Det Antel and CPS investigator Kristyn Wheeler thanked Jess for the information.

On June 30, 2023, STpr Hoffmeister with the Maryland State Police Criminal Enforcement Division authored a search and seizure warrant, that was signed by the Honorable William Jones of the District Court of Maryland Dorchester County, for the following devices: Item 1- Dark blue Motorola smartphone with cracked displayed. Item 2-Black Apple Iphone in black case On June 30, 2023, Cpl Wildman with the Maryland State Police Homicide Unit took possession of the above items to be forensically analyzed. On July 20, 2023, Cpl Wildman completed his examination of the devices and was only able to examine the Motorola phone. I, Sgt Antal, conducted a review of the data. The following are only brief overview of information located on the device and not a detailed account of the entire data: On May 21, 2023 at 1:20:15 pm, a text message from a number that is listed as Carroll Anne Wies states the following: Im not happy with u this morning both the kids are good the doctor checked over baby David and said that he was good they kept him for a couple of hours for observation and everythings okay we got to my house at 5am I dont know whats going to happen from here but if you got any questions call Dina when Im ready to talk to you Ill call you right now its just not the time Im very disappointed in you u cant admit it baby doll you have a serious problem with alcohol you cant control yourself so you cant be trusted with ur kids at all you took the first chance that you got and fucked up I hadnt even left you 3 hours and you got drunk told me I could trust you that you were so grateful that I trusted you and you fucked it all up your baby could have died but at your hands not from his sickness I hope you really realize how serious this is Case closed

On July 13, 2023, I, Sgt Antal, authored a search and seizure warrant for 9600 Cordova Road, Easton, Talbot County, Maryland, for a blue checkered blanket that was the suspected blanket used in the assault of David Valezquez. On July 13, 2023, the search and seizure warrant was executed at 9600 Cordova Road and the checked blanket was located in a bedroom on a bed. The item was photographed and seized according to the Maryland State Police rules and regulations and recorded on a MSP form 67..

On July 19, 2023, Joseph Coale, States Attorney for Talbot County Maryland, issued a special investigation subpoena to the Talbot County Detention Center for any and all text records from Somer Wilkes using the PayTel application. On July 21, 2023, I, Sgt Antal, made contact with Terry Kokolis, Director of the Talbot County Detention Center, who turned over the requested records to me with a certification of records. A review of the records at the time they were received did not reveal any text messaging conversations that were of any evidentiary value. Case Closed
